docstr: `BACKTRACE` â€” Show a backtrace ### Description `BACKTRACE` shows a backtrace at an arbitrary place in user code. Program execution continues normally afterwards. The backtrace information is printed to the unit corresponding to `ERROR_UNIT` in `ISO_FORTRAN_ENV`. ### Syntax `CALL BACKTRACE` ### Arguments None ### Standard GNU Extension ### Class Subroutine ### See also ABORT
